name: vs-deploy
description: Commands for deploying files of your workspace to a destination.

alwaysShowPackageList.description: Indicates if package list is shown, even if there is only one entry.

alwaysShowTargetList.description: Indicates if target list is shown, even if there is only one entry.

alwaysSyncIfNewer.description: Always synchronize a local file with a newer one when using 'sync when open' in a package.

autoSelectWorkspace.description: Select the workspace by active text editor automatically or not.

button.description: Settings for the 'quick deploy button' in the status bar.

enabled.description: Inidciates if button should be enabled / visible or not.

packages.description: A list of one or more packages to deploy.

text.description: A custom text for the button.

clearOutputOnStartup.description: Clear output on startup or not.

commands.description: A list of one or more script based commands to register.

oneOf.description: The command to register.

button.description: Settings for optional button in the status bar.

color.description: The custom (text) color for the button.

isRight.description: Set button on the right side or not.

show.description: Show button on startup or not.

command.description: The ID of the command.

script.description: The path to the script that is run when command is executed.

oneOf.description: The list of commands to register.

items.description: The command to register.

color.description: The custom (text) color for the button.

isRight.description: Set button on the right side or not.

show.description: Show button on startup or not.

command.description: The ID of the command.

script.description: The path to the script that is run when command is executed.

deployOnChange.description: Activate or deactivate 'deploy on change' for all packages.

deployOnSave.description: Activate or deactivate 'deploy on save' for all packages.

disableNewVersionPopups.description: Clear output on startup or not.

displayLoadedPlugins.description: Display loaded plugins in output window or not.

displayNetworkInfo.description: Display network information in output window or not.

env.description: Settings for the environment of the current process.

importVarsAsPlaceholders.description: Automatically import environment variables as placesholders / values or not.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL variables or not.

vars.description: One or more variable for the process to define.

items.description: An event entry.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if entry is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that entry is available for.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the entry is for.
One or more platform names the entry is for.

items.description: The name of platform the entry is for.

script.description: The path to the underlying script.

state.description: The initial value for the state.

fastCheckForIgnores.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for the list of ignored files.

fastCheckOnChange.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'deploy on change' for packages by default or not.

fastCheckOnSave.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'deploy on save' for packages by default or not.

fastCheckOnSync.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'sync when open' for packages by default or not.

globals.description: A list of variables that can be accessed globally (from scripts, e.g.).

hideDeployResultInStatusBarAfter.description: The time in seconds the result item in the status bar should disapear.

dir.description: The directory where incoming files should be stored.

maxMessageSize.description: Maximum size of one remote file message.

messageTransformer.description: The optional path to the script that transforms the data of a whole message AFTER it has been received.

messageTransformerOptions.description: The data for the 'message data transformation', if needed.

passwordAlgorithm.description: The algorithm for the password to use.

port.description: The TCP port the host should be listen on.

showPopupOnSuccess.description: Show popup if host has been started or stopped successfully.

transformer.description: The optional path to the script that transforms the data of a file AFTER it has been received.

transformerOptions.description: The data for the 'file data transformation', if needed.

validator.description: The optional path to the script that validates received files.

validatorOptions.description: The data for the 'validator', if needed.

oneOf.description: The pattern of files that should be ignored even if a deploy is started for them.
One or more pattern of files that should be ignored even if a deploy is started for them.

items.description: The pattern of files that should be ignored even if a deploy is started for them.

imports.description: One or more settings to import.

oneOf.description: The path to the import file.
One or more import entries.
The path to the import file.
The import file / entry.

description.description: An optional description for the entry.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if entry is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that entry is available for.

merge.description: Merge with parent settings or not.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the entry is for.
One or more platform names the entry is for.

items.description: The name of platform the entry is for.

language.description: The ID of the (display) language to use.

open.description: A list of files to open on startup.

closeOthers.description: Close other opened files or not.

exclude.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be execluded from opening.

files.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be opened.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if file(s) should be opened or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that filter is for.

useGitIgnoreStylePatterns.description: Also check directory patterns, like in '.gitignore' files, or not.

openOutputOnDeploy.description: Open the output window before deploying starts or not.

openOutputOnStartup.description: Open the output window on after settings have been (re)loaded or not.

packages.description: One or more packages that describe what files of the workspace should be deployed.

button.description: Defines a button that should be shown in the status bar for that package.

oneOf.description: Enable a button or not.
The button that should be shown in the status bar.

command.description: The custom ID for the underlying command.

isRight.description: Put button on the right side or not.

oneOf.description: The name of the target to deploy to.
The names of the targets to deploy to.

items.description: The name of the target to deploy to.

text.description: A custom text for the button.

tooltip.description: A custom tooltip for the button.

deployOnChange.description: One or more files to deploy if they change. (true) indicates to deploy to the targets of 'deployOnSave'.

exclude.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be execluded from deployment.

files.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be deployed. By default ALL files will be deployed.

useTargetList.description: Use 'targets' property of this package instead, otherwise use the settings 'deployOnSave'.

useGitIgnoreStylePatterns.description: Also check directory patterns, like in '.gitignore' files, or not.

deployOnSave.description: One or more name of targets to deploy to. (true) indicates to deploy to ALL targets.

detail.description: Additional information that should be shown in the GUI, e.g.

exclude.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be execluded from deployment.

files.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be deployed. By default ALL files will be deployed.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if package is available or not.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

noNodeModules.description: Exclude 'node_modules' directory by default or not.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the package is for.
One or more platform names the package is for.

items.description: The name of platform the package is for.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that package is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide package in GUI or not.

targets.description: One or more explicit targets to deploy to.

useTargetListForDeployOnSave.description: Use 'targets' property of this package instead, if its 'deployOnSave' property is set to (true).

fastCheckOnChange.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'deploy on change' for this packages or not.

fastCheckOnSave.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'deploy on save' for this package or not.

fastCheckOnSync.description: Indicates if a 'fast' file check should be used for 'sync when open' for this package or not.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that package.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

useGitIgnoreStylePatterns.description: Also check directory patterns, like in '.gitignore' files, in that package or not.

showForDeploy.description: Show this package for deploying in GUI or not.

showForPull.description: Show this package for pulling in GUI or not.

inheritFrom.description: One or more package name from where to inherit settings from.

oneOf.description: The package name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A package name from where to inherit settings from.

syncWhenOpen.description: Synchronizes local files with remote ones when opening it.

oneOf.description: Synchronizes all files of that package with remote ones when opening it or not.
The target from where to sync.

exclude.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be execluded from sync.

files.description: A list of one or more glob patterns of files that should be synced. By default ALL files will be synced.

target.description: The target from where to sync.

useGitIgnoreStylePatterns.description: Also check directory patterns, like in '.gitignore' files, or not.

useWorkspaceStartTimeForSyncWhenOpen.description: Use workspace start time for 'sync when open' for that package or not.

alwaysSyncIfNewer.description: Always synchronize a local file with a newer one when using 'sync when open' in that package.

runBuildTaskOnStartup.description: Indicates if build task should be run on startup or not.

oneOf.description: Indicates if build task should be run on startup or not.
Defines the number of milliseconds to wait before the build task is run.

runGitPullOnStartup.description: Indicates if Git pull should be run on startup or not.

oneOf.description: Indicates if Git pull should be run on startup or not.
Defines the number of milliseconds to wait before the Git sync is run.

showDeployResultInStatusBar.description: Show an item in the status bar after deployment or not.

showPopupOnSuccess.description: Indicates if an info popup / notification should be displayed after a successful deployment or not.

showWarningIfIgnored.description: Show a warning message if a (single) file has been ignored.

showWarningsForNonExistingTargets.description: Indicates if a warning popup / notification should be displayed if targets do not exist.

startApi.description: Starts the REST API or not (s. https://github.com/mkloubert/vs-rest-api).

startCronJobs.description: Starts the cron jobs or not (s. https://github.com/mkloubert/vs-cron).

startupCommands.description: A list of one or more Visual Studio Commands that should be run on startup.

arguments.description: Arguments for the execution.

command.description: The ID of the command.

command.description: The ID of the command.

targets.description: One or more targets that describe where files can be deployed to.

type.description: Deploys to a REST API that is compatible to 'vs-rest-api'.

port.description: The TCP of the API host.

transformer.description: The path to the script that transforms data before it is send / after it has been downloaded.

transformerOptions.description: Optional data for the transformer script.

promptForPassword.description: Prompt for a password if not defined.

detail.description: Additional information that should be shown in the GUI, e.g.

diffBeforeDeploy.description: Start a diff before deploy file(s) or not.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide target in GUI or not.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the target is for.
One or more platform names the target is for.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

showIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is only shown in GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

inheritFrom.description: One or more target name from where to inherit settings from.

oneOf.description: The target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

type.description: Does a HTTP request.

body.description: The body or the path to a script that returns the body to send.

isBodyBase64.description: Indicates if 'body' is Base64 encoded or not.

isBodyScript.description: Indicates if 'body' contains the path to a script instead the content to send.

options.description: The options for the script that returns the body to send.

arguments.description: A list of one or more optional arguments for the execution.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

options.description: Additional options for the script execution.

queries.description: One or more query to invoke.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

time.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before next operation is invoked.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

isBodyBase64.description: Indicates if 'body' is Base64 encoded or not.

isBodyScript.description: Indicates if 'body' contains the path to a script instead the content to send.

options.description: The options for the script that returns the body to send.

noPlaceholdersForTheseHeaders.description: A list of headers that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: The name of the header that should NOT use placeholders / values.
A list of headers that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the header that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL headers or not.

type.description: One or more local command to be run before deploy action

arguments.description: A list of one or more optional arguments for the execution.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL environment variables or not.

envVars.description: An object that defines environment variables for the new process by properties.

useEnvVarsOfWorkspace.description: Also use environment variables of the process of current workspace or not.

usePlaceholdersInArguments.description: Use placeholders in arguments or not.

type.description: Runs a script from a file.

options.description: Additional options for the script execution.

script.description: The path to the script file.

type.description: Executes SQL scripts.

oneOf.description: MySQL
Microsoft SQL

queries.description: One or more query to invoke.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

time.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before next operation is invoked.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL environment variables or not.

envVars.description: An object that defines environment variables for the new process by properties.

useEnvVarsOfWorkspace.description: Also use environment variables of the process of current workspace or not.

type.description: Deploys to a container of an Azure blob storage.

account.description: The name of the storage account.

checkBeforeDeploy.description: Check for newer files before a deployment starts or not.

container.description: The name of the container inside the storage.

contentType.description: Defines the content type for files explicit.

detectMime.description: Detect the MIME type for a file automatically or not.

dir.description: The target directory.

publicAccessLevel.description: The publib access level of the container.

transformer.description: The path to the script that transforms data before it is send / after it has been downloaded.

transformerOptions.description: Optional data for the transformer script.

promptForKey.description: Prompt for an access key if not defined.

detail.description: Additional information that should be shown in the GUI, e.g.

diffBeforeDeploy.description: Start a diff before deploy file(s) or not.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if target is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide target in GUI or not.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the target is for.
One or more platform names the target is for.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

showIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is only shown in GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

inheritFrom.description: One or more target name from where to inherit settings from.

oneOf.description: The target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the target is for.
One or more platform names the target is for.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

showIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is only shown in GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

inheritFrom.description: One or more target name from where to inherit settings from.

oneOf.description: The target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

type.description: Does a HTTP request.

body.description: The body or the path to a script that returns the body to send.

isBodyBase64.description: Indicates if 'body' is Base64 encoded or not.

isBodyScript.description: Indicates if 'body' contains the path to a script instead the content to send.

options.description: The options for the script that returns the body to send.

A list of headers that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL headers or not.

type.description: One or more local command to be run before deploy action

arguments.description: A list of one or more optional arguments for the execution.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

options.description: Additional options for the script execution.

script.description: The path to the script file.

type.description: Executes SQL scripts.

oneOf.description: MySQL
Microsoft SQL

queries.description: One or more query to invoke.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

time.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before next operation is invoked.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL environment variables or not.

envVars.description: An object that defines environment variables for the new process by properties.

useEnvVarsOfWorkspace.description: Also use environment variables of the process of current workspace or not.

detail.description: Additional information that should be shown in the GUI, e.g.

diffBeforeDeploy.description: Start a diff before deploy file(s) or not.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if target is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide target in GUI or not.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

oneOf.description: The target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

queries.description: One or more query to invoke.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

time.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before next operation is invoked.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
The list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL environment variables or not.

envVars.description: An object that defines environment variables for the new process by properties.

useEnvVarsOfWorkspace.description: Also use environment variables of the process of current workspace or not.

beforeDeploy.description: One or more operations to be run before deploy action.

type.description: Deploys to a HTTP server/service.

headers.description: The optional list of additional request headers to send.

password.description: The optional password for basic authentication to use.

submitContentType.description: Submit the 'Content-type' request header or not.

submitDate.description: Submit the 'Date' request header or not.

submitFileHeader.description: Submit the 'X-vsdeploy-file' request header that contains the path of the file that is submitted.

transformer.description: The optional path to the script that transforms the data of the file BEFORE it is send.

transformerOptions.description: The data for the 'data transformation', if needed.

user.description: The optional username for basic authentication.

encodeUrlValues.description: Encode URL values with 'encodeURIComponent' or not.

submitFile.description: Submit the content of a file or not.

promptForPassword.description: Prompt for a password if not defined.

detail.description: Additional information that should be shown in the GUI, e.g.

diffBeforeDeploy.description: Start a diff before deploy file(s) or not.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if target is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide target in GUI or not.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the target is for.
One or more platform names the target is for.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

showIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is only shown in GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

inheritFrom.description: One or more target name from where to inherit settings from.

oneOf.description: The target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

queries.description: One or more query to invoke.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

time.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before next operation is invoked.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

noPlaceholdersForTheseVars.description: A list of environment variables that should NOT use placeholders.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

oneOf.description: Defines if placeholders should be DEactivated for ALL environment variables or not.

useEnvVarsOfWorkspace.description: Also use environment variables of the process of current workspace or not.

beforeDeploy.description: One or more operations to be run before deploy action.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if target is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

isHidden.description: Hide target in GUI or not.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

target.description: The target directory to map the files of source directory to.

isRegEx.description: Indicates if 'source' contains a regular expression instead of a static string.

oneOf.description: The name of the platform the target is for.

items.description: The name of platform the target is for.

applyValuesTo.description: A list of property names and their values that should be applied to that target.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

inheritFrom.description: One or more target name from where to inherit settings from.

items.description: A target name from where to inherit settings from.

loadFrom.description: The path to the JSON file from where to import data.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

type.description: Executes a Visual Studio Code command.

command.description: The ID of the command to execute.

arguments.description: One or more optional argument for the execution.

submitContext.description: Submit an operation context object as first argument or not.

type.description: Waits a number of milliseconds, before the next operation is executed.

type.description: Executes Microsoft's Web Deploy tool (msdeploy).

allowUntrusted.description: When specified, untrusted SSL connections are allowed; otherwise, untrusted SSL Connections are not allowed.

appHostConfigDir.description: Specifies the path of the ApplicationHost.config file for the current instance of IIS Express.

args.description: One or more additional arguments for the execution.

declareParam.description: Creates a user-specified parameter for a package or archive. When the package or archive is later synchronized, the value of the declared parameter is specified by using 'setParam'.

declareParamFile.description: Specifies an XML file that contains declarations of parameters that will be used in an operation. The XML format of the declared parameters matches that of the parameters that are found in the archive or package.

dest.description: Specifies the destination (the target object) of the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies. The and its associated settings more narrowly define the destination object or how it will be processed.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

handleAs.description: The type to convert the user's input to.

isPassword.description: Input value is secret / a password.

showAlways.description: Always show input box even if cached.

text.description: The text for the input box.

oneOf.description: Does no conversion.
Convert to a boolean value.
Convert to an integer value.
Convert to a number / float value.
Parses a value as JSON string.

validator.description: The path to an optional script that validates a value.

valuePlaceHolder.description: The placeholder for the input box.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

dir.description: The custom working directory for the execution.

disableLink.description: Disables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'disableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

disableRule.description: Disables the specified synchronization rule or rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'disableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

enableLink.description: Enables one or more specified link extensions during a synchronization operation. The link extensions are specified after 'enableLink' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the link extension names directly, or use regular expressions that resolve to valid Web Deploy link extension names.

enableRule.description: Enables one or more synchronization rules during a synchronization operation. The rules are specified after 'enableRule' in a comma-delimited list. You can specify the rule names directly, or use a regular expression that resolves to valid Web Deploy rules. The specified rule name can also be followed by an asterisk wildcard character.

postSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination after a synchronization completes.

preSync.description: Runs the specified command or batch file on the destination before a synchronization starts.

removeParam.description: Removes a parameter definition from the list of declared parameters.

replace.description: Specifies items to replace during a synchronization operation. More than one 'replace' argument can appear on the same command line.

retryAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the provider will retry after a failure.

retryInterval.description: Specifies, in milliseconds, the interval between provider retry attempts.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

setParam.description: Specifies values during a sync operation for the parameters that you specify.

setParamFile.description: Applies parameter settings from an XML 'answer' file during a sync operation.

showSecure.description: When specified, displays encrypted configuration properties (such as passwords) in clear text when the output format is XML.

skip.description: Specifies an action or object to be excluded during a synchronization operation.

source.description: Specifies the source of the data for the operation that the 'verb' argument specifies.

unicode.description: Specifies that the string values for the username and password provider settings will be encoded in UTF-8.

useCheckSum.description: Specifies that files will be compared by using their CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) checksum and ignoring their last write time.

verb.description: Specifies the action that the operation will perform.

verbose.description: Specifies that the Informational verbosity level will be included in the output of the operation.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

webServerDir.description: Specifies the path of the program files for the current instance of IIS Express.

whatif.description: Specifies that the command will be run without actually making any changes.

xml.description: Specifies that the output should be returned in XML format.

xpath.description: Specifies an XPath expression to apply to XML output.

type.description: Deploys to a SFTP server.

agent.description: Name or path to ssh-agent for ssh-agent-based user authentication.

agentForward.description: Set to (true) to use OpenSSH agent forwarding (auth-agent@openssh.com) for the life of the connection. 'agent' property must also be set to use this feature.

checkBeforeDeploy.description: Check for newer files before a deployment starts or not.

dir.description: The remote directory on the server.

hashAlgorithm.description: The algorithm to use to verify the fingerprint of a host.

host.description: The host address of the server.

port.description: The TCP port of the server.

privateKey.description: The path to the private key file, if authentification should be done via SSH key.

privateKeySourceFormat.description: The source format of the private key.

privateKeyTargetFormat.description: The custom target format of the private key.

privateKeyPassphrase.description: The passphrase for the key file, if needed.

readyTimeout.description: How long (in milliseconds) to wait for the SSH handshake to complete.

tryKeyboard.description: Try keyboard-interactive user authentication if primary user authentication method fails.

convertCRLF.description: Convert CR+LF to LF in text files or not.

encoding.description: The encoding (like 'ascii' or 'utf8') for the conversion to use.

transformer.description: The path to the script that transforms data before it is send / after it has been downloaded.

transformerOptions.description: Optional data for the transformer script.

oneOf.description: The (octal) 'chmod' access permission value for all files.
One or more regular expressions with their 'chmod' access permission values.

.*.description: The (octal) 'chmod' access permission value for the maching files files.

verbose.description: Output execution or not.

hideIf.description: A list of one or more package names that indicates if that target is hidden from GUI if one of the package(s) has been selected.

if.description: A list of one or more conditions (as JavaScript code) that defines if target is available or not.

isFor.description: A list of one or more (host)names that target is visible for.

mappings.description: One or more folder mapping to add.

source.description: The directory that should be mapped.

.*.description: The value (with optional placeholders) that should be applied to the property.

body.description: The body or the path to a script that returns the body to send.

isBodyScript.description: Indicates if 'body' contains the path to a script instead the content to send.

options.description: The options for the script that returns the body to send.

arguments.description: A list of one or more optional arguments for the execution.

runInTerminal.description: Run in integrated terminal or not.

wait.description: Wait until execution has been finished or not.

oneOf.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.

items.description: The name of the environment variable that should NOT use placeholders / values.
